incidents.name: Small number of Actors unable to start

incident_updates.body:
Due to an internal misconfiguration, between October 15, 11:00 UTC and October 16, 6:30 UTC, a small number of Actors were unable to start, either when started via API, or when scheduled to run regularly. We have identified the issue and implemented a fix, and the Actors are now starting normally.

There was no data loss, and no excessive charges for the failed Actors.

We apologize for the inconvenience, and we will contact the affected users soon.
There was an increased error rate for amazon.com and facebook.com between 05:30 and 06:30 UTC.

components.name: Residential
components.description: Download your data over IP addresses located in homes and offices of people all around the world. These IPs have the lowest chance of blocking and best geographical coverage.

incident_updates.body: Between 0:26 and 0:41 UTC some Actor Builds started failing. We are investigating whether the cause is the outage of NPM https://status.npmjs.org/incidents/zvpm95sgl89p and are monitoring the situation.

incidents.name: Intermittent API, Console and Actor slowdowns and failures

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Due to a database overload, some API calls, Console operations and Actor runs were slowed down and possibly failed between 13:10 and 13:40 UTC. The overload has ended, and the problems are resolved. We are monitoring the situation to detect any further issues early.

incident_updates.body:
We experienced an issue with one of our database replicas which caused some of our systems to restart.
There was no data loss but running jobs could have issues with connection to API and Proxz and have been migrated to new workers.

We’ve experienced internal system issues between 18:20 UTC and 21:30 UTC. The error caused a data duplication resulting in a ~30 of users being overcharged by 10 USD on average, and some of the storage and run statistics were duplicated. The underlying issue has been addressed and we’ll be contacting the impacted users over next week.
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Not all the domains were affected by the incident. 

We are sorry for any inconvenience caused.
We are experiencing a partial disruption of Apify's residential proxy service due to the disruption of some of our external vendors. We are currently re-balancing the traffic to remediate the issue.

components.name: Residential
components.description: Download your data over IP addresses located in homes and offices of people all around the world. These IPs have the lowest chance of blocking and best geographical coverage.

incident_updates.body: We experienced a short proxy disruption between about 9:10 UTC and 9:15 UTC. This was caused by a slow failover of a caching system. Everything got back up shortly, and we are monitoring the situation.

incidents.name: Degraded performance of some integrations (Gmail, Gdrive, Asana, Trello, GitHub)

incident_updates.body:
The reliability of the listed integrations is now close to normal.
Some invocations occasionally need to be retried to get a successful response.

One of our integration partners has been experiencing degraded stability of their integrations:
- Gmail
- Gdrive
- Asana
- Trello
- GitHub

Some invocations have not been fired. We work with our partner on resolving the issue and ensuring it won't happen again.

components.name: Webhooks
components.description: Webhooks provide an easy and reliable way to configure the Apify platform to carry out an action when a certain system event occurs. For example, you can use webhooks to start another actor when an actor run finishes or fails.

incidents.name: Degraded performance of some integrations (Gmail, Gdrive, Asana, Trello, GitHub)

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

One of our integration partners has been experiencing degraded stability of their integrations for the past few hours:
- Gmail
- Gdrive
- Asana
- Trello
- GitHub

Some invocations have not been fired. Everything is recovered at this point. We work with our partner to ensure that this won't happen again, as this is a critical functionality.

The original root cause was discovered. We identified the root cause as a database cluster issue and implemented a successful recovery yesterday. Our systems are now stable and functioning optimally. 

Impact:

As a result of this issue, some users of pay-per-result Actors were charged more than they should have paid if the run was running during one of the following intervals:
- 2024/07/03 15-17 UTC
- 2024/07/04 04-06 UTC

We are currently investigating the full scope of this issue and will issue refunds to affected users within the next week. Based on our initial assessment, the number of impacted users is limited.

Future Prevention:

Over the coming week, our team will prioritize implementing more measures to prevent similar incidents in the future. We consider this issue a high-severity matter and are committed to ensuring the continued reliability of our services.

We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this caused.
A long-term fix was deployed to the production environment to mitigate another performance drop. We will keep monitoring the system.

We have identified the cause of the issue and implemented a workaround. A proper fix will be deployed later today.

There was no data loss, however the performance of Actors and API operations was degraded between 4 AM and 6 AM UTC 2024-07-04, and some scheduled Actors and tasks might have been triggered twice.
The incident reappeared. Although the previous fix lessened the impact, we're still facing degraded performance of Actor runs and builds.
A fix has been implemented and we will keep monitoring the results.
The system is operating normally at this point. We are still investigating the issue and will be implementing new measures.
The performance of Actor runs and builds is degraded. We are experiencing a slowdown in our internal systems and are investigating the issue.

incident_updates.body: We have identified the likely causes of the issue and taken steps to mitigate them.

Runs and builds of Actors were on hold for roughly 7 minutes due to an issue with our internal systems. The incident is now resolved and we are investigating the root causes to prevent it from occurring again. There was no data loss, some runs may have timed out and can be resurrected.

We have identified the cause and working towards swift resolution. This has been happening since 2024-06-04 6:00 UTC.

This affects the delivery of account verification email, monitoring emails and system notifications.

components.name: Console (console.apify.com)
components.description: Application running at console.apify.com

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We have addressed the issue. All services should be operational and we are monitoring their health. The degraded performance was caused by an internal infrastructure issue. No data was lost, but some Actors have failed and timed out. These can be resurrected from the Apify Console. 

We apologize for the inconvenience and will be holding an internal post-mortem to make sure similar incidents won't happen in the future.
We have identified the likely root cause of the problem and are taking steps to resolve the issues as soon as possible.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
Our API is experiencing an increased error rate and the API requests might be failing. We are currently investigating the issue.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

All the workloads have recovered. There was no data loss, but Actors were disrupted at different levels from about 16:00 UTC up until 18:00 UTC.

The problem was caused by the resolution of internal DNS records. We are currently monitoring the situation and releasing changes to beware of this in the future. 

We are sorry for all the inconvenience caused. Reliability is our priority, and we will be implementing more changes to prevent such situations in the future.
Actor runtime has a complete outage. The actors are not running. There is no data loss. We are working on discovering the root cause.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. There was no data loss as requests are being retried, but some of the Actor runs may have failed. You can resurrect the failed runs (https://docs.apify.com/platform/actors/running/runs-and-builds#resurrection-of-finished-run) to continue running.
While the proxy was the main affected component, the problem was related to our IAM service and other components like API, Actors or webhooks were affected as well.

We have experienced an outage of the service managing IAM from 12:50 to 13:00 UTC. This was due to a misconfiguration while releasing a new version. We have reverted the release and everything is operational again.

incidents.name: API performance degraded and outage of Actors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We have experienced two restarts of our servers that run Actors. It was caused by performance degradation of our API. There was no data loss. Some Actors may have failed and you can resurrect them to make them work again. We isolated the root cause and we're implementing measures to prevent this from happening in the future.
We are currently investigating degraded API performance and outage of Actors
We are currently investigating degraded API performance

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue was resolved, and only a single customer was affected. We are monitoring the situation.
We are experiencing a degraded performance of Apify API and are investigating the root cause. Only the performance (response time) is impacted, with no impact on data quality or anything else.

components.name: API (api.apify.com)

incidents.name: Actor builds might fail and the overall performance might be degraded

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The health of upstream dependencies has been resolved and we are in turn no longer experiencing degraded performance.

AWS is currently experiencing degraded performance and a higher error rate (https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status). This has a cascading effect on different external systems, such as DockerHub, affecting in turn us as well. Most notably, we're experiencing a higher error rate on Actor builds. We will continue to monitor the health of upstream services and of our platform to mitigate any potential issues.

components.description: Actors are serverless cloud programs running on Apify that can perform arbitrary computing jobs, such as send an email or crawl a website with millions of pages.

incidents.name: Degraded stability of static proxy groups

incident_updates.body:
We experienced a short incident during which the stability of Apify's static proxy groups (StaticUS1 and StaticUS3) was degraded. Default data center proxy groups were not affected by this incident. 

Problems were resolved in about 30 minutes. We are monitoring the situation to make sure that the situation is permanently resolved.

incidents.name: Increased error rate and latency across all services

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

The problem was fixed on the AWS cloud side. Everything is back to a normal state, and elevated error rates are resolved. 

The whole Apify platform stayed operational throughout the incident, but the elevated error rates of our API caused a performance drop. This may have caused some Actor runs to fail. In such cases, you can resurrect them (https://docs.apify.com/platform/actors/running/runs-and-builds#resurrection-of-finished-run), and the runs will continue from the point of failure.
As the cloud provider has issues with identity access management, the error rate of all operations is higher than usual, resulting in Actors' degraded performance.
Due to an issue at our cloud service provider, most of our services are experiencing increased error rates and latencies. We are investigating the issue and will attempt to mitigate the impact.

incident_updates.body: There was a short outage of the residential proxy with the country selection France. The problems lasted for about 15 minutes. No other countries were affected. The problem is fixed, and we are monitoring the state.
This incident has been resolved.
The problem with the US region is fixed. We are monitoring the situation to make sure that the issue won't re-appear.

incident_updates.body:
Small percentage of actor runs could not be started and new actors could not be created from templates.
We have identified the issue and deployed a fix. This incident lasted 17 minutes.
There was no data loss. All the actors may have been restarted. Actors already running were not affected.
This incident has been resolved.

We are sorry for the inconvenience caused. Problems were happening between 00:00 UTC and 6:30 UTC, causing residential proxy workloads to fail. We will be launching changes to our residential proxy service that will mitigate similar issues in the future.
A fix has been implemented, and the residential proxy is back up. We will keep monitoring the system. Other proxy types were not affected.

incidents.name: Actor runtime unavailable for about 5 minutes

incident_updates.body: Due to an abnormally slow switch between the primary and replica of our database clusters, the worker machines that the host actor runs got restarted. The accumulated workload caused some runs to be delayed by about 3-5 minutes. Runs continued normally with no data loss but runs with a low timeout may have timed out.
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
The performance has been restored and is under monitoring.
The API of the performance is degraded. The root cause has been identified and we are currently working on a fix. The platform remains fully operational.

components.name: API (api.apify.com)
components.description: Back-end services running at https://api.apify.com

incident_updates.body:
Due to an increased load and delayed scaling the performance of some services was degraded for short periods of time during the past 30 minutes  

This mainly affects the API response time and so the speed of Apify actors. There was no data loss or service disruption, but the overall performance was degraded at different levels.

The underlying issue has been addressed, and the performance has been restored. We are implementing measures so that this won't occur again.
Issue has been resolved. We are monitoring the situation to beware of further disruptions.
We are experiencing an outage of residential proxies caused by a downtime of one of our providers. We are monitoring the situation and working with our partner on recovery.

incident_updates.body: We experienced a temporary degradation of the API performance while the rest of the system was operating normally.
This incident has been resolved.

We have identified the issue and implemented a fix. All datacenter proxy groups should be back to usual performance. We will continue monitoring the proxy status.

If your actor uses the "auto" proxy configuration, it could have experienced reduced performance due to higher error rate. If it uses a BUYPROXIES proxy group directly, it could have failed connecting to the proxy server.
Some datacenter proxy groups of Apify Proxy are having an outage. We have identified the issue and we are implementing a fix.

Our email provider is experiencing a major outage so at the moment we are unable to send email notifications or password reset emails.

This also affects https://apify.com/apify/send-mail actor. For more info follow the incident at https://status.mailgun.com/

We have identified the issue and applied an immediate fix, and the performance is back to normal. We are continuing to monitor the platform for further issues.

incident_updates.body: The issue is resolved, all systems are operational. We're taking further measures to prevent similar incidents in the future. All services are operating within normal parameters. We'll keep monitoring our database for a while, before closing the incident.

incident_updates.body:
During an infrastructure update, we had to restart all the machines that the host actor runs. This restart took longer than expected and machines were unavailable for about 2-5 minutes. All actors were paused and continued running unless the timeout was hit.

We are sorry for any inconvenience caused. We will now focus on both smoothening these updates and speeding up of restart times to minimize such disruptions.
This incident has been resolved.

A fix has been implemented and we are continuing to monitor the issue.

There was a short interval of downgraded performance of our API, which caused some actor runs with a short timeout to fail. There was no data loss.
We are experiencing a drop in performance of our API. We are currently investigating this issue and we will post an update soon.

components.description: Actors are serverless cloud programs running on Apify that can perform arbitrary computing jobs, such as send an email or crawl a website with millions of pages.

incidents.name: Partial outage of Apify platform due to the AWS incident

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The whole system is finally fully recovering, the problems started at 20:45 UTC, and since that some actors might have been paused or timing out. We are sorry for the inconvenience caused.

We are experiencing an outage of our cloud provider Amazon Web Services (AWS) with the AWS SQS and AWS Lambda services we depend on to be completely down. Also, AWS EC2 APIs are having a very high error rate. For more info see:
- https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status
- https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=30619871

Due to these problems, we are not able to maintain a high enough pool of servers and many actors are delayed and are timing out. We are in monitoring the situation and minimizing the impact on our customers. Our APIs are operating normally.

components.name: Actors
components.description: Actors are serverless cloud programs running on Apify that can perform arbitrary computing jobs, such as send an email or crawl a website with millions of pages.

incident_updates.body:
We experienced a slowdown of Apify API between 9:20 and 9:50 at different levels. All systems were operational during the incident only the API performance was affected.

Everything is back to normal, we identified a cause of stress on the API backend and will implement a rate limit to prevent such incidents in the future.

We are sorry for any inconvenience caused.
